text:
Possibly an unpopular opinion, but let me know what you think:

Have to remember that SEMRush is an SEO tool first, not editorial or content marketing. Content primarily with that in mind is slowly becoming commoditized

Therefore, they are tailoring to what SEOs look for primarily when producing content, which is mostly full-filling the need to pump out content consistently that are focused around pre-researched content topics and keywords — not necessarily to win editorial or storytelling awards.

Additionally, SEO works very much in the sense of an MVP mentality - aka let’s get this out the door as best as possible, forego a lot of the bottle necks found in traditional editorial writing, and come back to it once it accumulates data to dictate that possibly retouching or upgrading decision.
